data.text:
What better time to announce Draftboard’s $4.1M funding round than under the shadow of attack drones and cruise missiles? 🤣 About 2 years ago I was sitting on my couch and had an idea to completely disrupt how companies hire. I sat on it for almost 6 months. Because I was afraid I’d actually have to go build it. Like lots of other people, I kept a list of startup ideas, even though I had zero desire to be a founder. When I consulted that list after leaving IAC, I confirmed what I thought: they all sucked. But when this new idea hit, it was different. Finally, after months of hesitating, I decided to explore it, however tentatively. I fleshed out the vision & opportunity in a 3-page essay - I needed to test if the logic withstood the rigor of actually writing it out. I asked a close friend (Shlomo Dalezman) about the technical feasibility of it. I sketched dozens of wireframes on a whiteboard. I found a great designer in South Africa to build out some super simple mockups and put together a 13-page deck. And then it was go time. 18 months later we’ve got thousands of scouts referring candidates. We’ve had 70 companies list their roles. We’ve had almost $1M in referral bonuses posted. And we’re just getting started. But I wouldn’t be here with my incredible investors, and that’s why I’m thrilled to announce this round of funding. Taylor Greene knew within ten seconds that Twelve Below was all-in. Amanda Herson met me for coffee on a brisk fall day and I knew she & Founder Collective would be an incredible asset. David Stark & Ground Up Ventures are just as incredible as partners as I knew they would be, and deserve serious credit for getting me to - for the first time - seriously consider taking the founder leap. And Nico Berardi and Antonio Osio at ANIMO Ventures are avid - and active - supporters every day. Between them and the dozens of angels and friends & family, I and my amazing team count ourselves incredibly fortunate to get to build this vision out with all their support. The journey is long and arduous, but the goal is worth it. Onwards and upwards. Draftboard team: Steven Sosnick Dzmitry Shokel Dzmitry Shavel Estee Rebibo Mikalai Rudak Siarhei Rudak Yasmin Levin Sam Goldberg Alexey Kibrik #hiring #techcrunch #funding

📣 Exciting News! 🌟 Arrive Recommerce is thrilled to announce major developments that are propelling us to new heights in the recommerce industry. 🎉💼 🔸 Series A Funding: We are excited to share that we have raised $16M in Series A funding! This investment will enable us to expand our platform to more brands and operators, further solidifying our position as a leader in the booming recommerce market. 📈 🔸 Introducing the Arrive Recommerce Operators Consortium: We are proud to unveil our collaboration with industry giants including A.P. Moller - Maersk, DHL Supply Chain, SCI Group Inc, Ryder System, Inc., and more! This consortium aims to promote and expand the use of recommerce management technology worldwide, fostering global adoption of sustainable practices. 🌍🤝 Our modular and easy-to-implement Recommerce Management Technology empowers brands and retailers to launch profitable, branded, and sustainable resale channels. By transforming returns, excess inventory, and damaged inventory into fully-branded revenue-generating resale opportunities, we are driving profitability and sustainability hand in hand. ♻️💪 This achievement wouldn't have been possible without the support of our incredible team at Arrive Recommerce and our investors. We extend our deepest gratitude to Javelin Venture Partners, Climactic, Maersk Growth, Sidekick Partners, Cosmic Venture Partners, 444 Capital, Freestyle Capital, ANIMO Ventures, Banana Capital, Alpaca VC, Regeneration.VC and Wedbush Ventures and others for believing in our vision and joining us on this incredible journey. 🙏💼 To learn more about Arrive and our mission to drive profitability and sustainability through recommerce, visit thearrivepltaform.com #ArriveRecommerce #Recommerce #Sustainability #Innovation #CircularEconomy
